oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Music & the Spoken Word - Mormon Tabernacle Choir radio program - Episode 749 Part 2 - 1943-11-28 - KSL - WLAC
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Syndicated radio broadcast of the Music & the Spoken Word radio program, originally broadcast from KSL (Salt Lake City, Utah). Recorded from Temple Square in Salt Lake City, Utah, the program is narrated by Richard L. Evans, conducted by J. Spencer Cornwall, and performed by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir with Alexander Schreiner on organ. This is the second part of the 749th airing, recorded on November 28, 1943. Part one: TR004033_1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Alexander Schreiner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (0:23) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs a piece composed by Johann Crüger / (3:57) Richard L. Evans reads a passage about Thanksgiving / (6:57) Alexander Schreiner performs "Crown Him With Many Crowns The Lamb Of God Upon His Throne," composed by George Elvey [phonetic] / (7:45) Richard L. Evans talks about the previous song and introduces the next performance / (8:10) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs an arrangement of an arioso composed by George Frideric Handel / (13:16) Richard L. Evans announces the closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Music and the spoken word (Radio program); KSL (Radio station : Salt Lake City, Utah); WLAC (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.)
